oracle.pg.rdbms.index.oratext

Class RDBMSOracleTextVertexAutoIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.pg.rdbms.index.oratext.OracleTextAutoIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex>
      • oracle.pg.rdbms.index.oratext.RDBMSOracleTextVertexAutoIndex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Index<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex>, OracleAutoIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex>, OracleIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex>

    public class RDBMSOracleTextVertexAutoIndex
extends OracleTextAutoIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex>
    This class extends the functions defined in OracleTextAutoIndex to handle an automatic index on vertices using Oracle Text.

      • RDBMSOracleTextVertexAutoIndex

        public RDBMSOracleTextVertexAutoIndex(java.lang.String indexName,
                                      OraclePropertyGraph opg,
                                      com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Parameter[] indexParameters,
                                      boolean erase)
        Constructs a new RDBMSOracleTextVertexAutoIndex object.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index
        opg - an OraclePropertyGraph object.
        indexParameters - a collection of parameters for the underlying index implementation.
        erase - a boolean specifying if the index should be cleared at the beginning.

    • Method Detail

      • count

        public long count(java.lang.String key,
                  java.lang.Object value,
                  java.lang.Class dtClass,
                  boolean acceptWildcard)
        Counts all the matching elements that have a particular key/value property within the index
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property. It MUST not be NULL. If the key is not found in the index, the result will be 0.
        value - the value object of the property. It can be NULL which will cause all vertices with the given key to be returned.
        dtClass - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtValue is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object. the index
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.

      • dropIndex

        public void dropIndex()
        Clears all data stored in the index.

      • get

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.CloseableIterable<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex> get(java.lang.Object query)
        Gets an Iterable object with all the matching elements that match the given query object
        Parameters:
        query - a OracleTextQueryObject object.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.

      • get

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.CloseableIterable<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex> get(java.lang.String key,
                                                                                       java.lang.Object value,
                                                                                       java.lang.Class dtValue,
                                                                                       boolean acceptWildcard)
        Gets all vertices indexed by the provided key/value.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the indexed vertices.
        value - the value of the indexed vertices.
        dtValue - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtClass is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        Returns:
        an iterable of vertices that have a particular key/value in the index.

      • getDirectoryName

        public java.lang.String getDirectoryName()
        Gets the directory name for this index.
        Returns:
        the directory name for this index.

      • getDocIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getDocIdentifier()
        Get index document's identifier.
        Returns:
        a String representing the document's identifier based on the entity type it handles (vertex or vertex).

      • getIndexedKeys

        public final java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getIndexedKeys()
        Gets a list of all the indexed keys used for this automatic index.
        Returns:
        the set of keys used in this index.

      • getPartitioned

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.CloseableIterable<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex>[] getPartitioned(java.lang.Object[] connections,
                                                                                                    java.lang.Object query,
                                                                                                    int iStartPartitionId)
        Gets an array of CloseableIterable objects that hold all the vertices with an attribute matching the Query object. Each vertex in the CloseableIterable array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from a table partition. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the partitions in a table with N partitions. The subset of partitions queried will consist of those partitions with ID value in the range of [iStartPartitionId, iStartPartitionId - 1 + size of connections array].
        Parameters:
        connections - an array of Connection connections to the Oracle Database where the Oracle Text relies.
        query - a OracleTextQueryObject object.
        iStartPartitionId - the ID of the starting partition.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.

      • getPartitioned

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.CloseableIterable<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex>[] getPartitioned(java.lang.Object[] connections,
                                                                                                    java.lang.String key,
                                                                                                    java.lang.Object value,
                                                                                                    java.lang.Class dtValue,
                                                                                                    boolean acceptWildcard,
                                                                                                    int iStartPartitionId)
        Gets an array of CloseableIterable objects that hold all the vertices with an attribute matching the Query object. Each vertex in the CloseableIterable array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from a table partition. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the partitions in a table with N partitions. The subset of partitions queried will consist of those partitions with ID value in the range of [iStartPartitionId, iStartPartitionId - 1 + size of connections array].
        Parameters:
        connections - an array of Connection connections to the Oracle Database where the Oracle Text relies.
        key - the key of a property
        value - the value object of the property.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        iStartPartitionId - the ID of the starting partition.
        dtValue - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtClass is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.

      • getPartitionsNumber

        public int getPartitionsNumber()
        Gets the number of HASH partitions of the vertices table for the associated property graph.
        Returns:
        the number of HASH partitions of the element's table.

        Gets the number of partitions in this index.
